required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of Motor Skills in the Elderly: the Role of Cognitive Abilities for Imagining and Planning Movement.
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Motor Skills in the Elderly: the Role of Cognitive Abilities for Imagining and Planning Movement.

brief_summary.textblock: Falling is an event that is more frequent and severe in older age. It can lead to a loss of autonomy and a decrease in quality of life. It is therefore important to understand this phenomenon in order to better prevent it. Among the multiple risk factors associated with falling, recent research has shown a link between the decline in cognitive abilities (i.e., the mental processes that form our knowledge, such as memory) and the risk of falling. However, the impact of this cognitive decline on motor skills is still poorly understood. The purpose of this research is to study how the changes induced by aging affect motor skills. This would make it possible to take a new look at the phenomenon of falls occurring in the elderly and, in the long term, to improve the prevention and rehabilitation.

primary_outcome.measure: Sequence 1: symmetry ratio of the finger speed profile
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 years

primary_outcome.measure: Sequence 2 : perception bias (error in degrees of angle) of dynamic subjective visual vericality
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 years

primary_outcome.measure: Sequence 3 : activation time of the focal muscles in relation to the postural muscles
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 years

primary_outcome.measure: Sequence 4: temporal congruence between the duration of a movement realized and imagined
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 years

primary_outcome.measure: Sequence 5: speed achieved after the mental training sessions
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 years

primary_outcome.measure: Sequence 5: accuracy achieved after the mental training sessions
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 years
primary_outcome.description: speed-precision pointing test on a touch-sensitive tablet

arm_group.arm_group_label: Elderly subjects with mild cognitive impairment
arm_group.description: people over 70 years of age, with a diagnosis of mild cognitive impairment

intervention.description: perform arm movements towards a target
intervention.arm_group_label: Elderly subjects with mild cognitive impairment

intervention.description: judge the verticality of an object
intervention.arm_group_label: Elderly subjects with mild cognitive impairment

intervention.description: In standing position, point as quickly as possible with the right arm at the diode that will light up in front of the participant.
intervention.arm_group_label: Elderly subjects with mild cognitive impairment

intervention.description: Composed of 5 sessions of about 15 minutes each (5 consecutive days), it will be required to perform a walking test (10 meters) in 3 different conditions and a manual dexterity test. Participants will be asked to imagine carrying out these tests during the training sessions.
intervention.arm_group_label: Elderly subjects with mild cognitive impairment

intervention.description: Composed of 5 sessions of about 20 minutes each (5 consecutive days), it will be asked to perform pointing movements of the arm. It will be asked to imagine these movements during training sessions.
intervention.arm_group_label: Elderly subjects with mild cognitive impairment

study_pop.textblock: young subjects, elderly neurotypical subjects and elderly subjects with mild cognitive disorder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Neurotypical subjects group:
- Person aged 18 to 40 years
- Person who has given oral consent
- Affiliated to national health insurance
- Right-handed person
2. Group of elderly neurotypical subjects:
- Person over 70 years of age
- Person who has given oral consent
- Affiliated to national health insurance
- No cognitive problems (MMSE score >26)
- Right-handed person
3. Elderly mild cognitive disorder subject group:
- Person over 70 years of age
- Person who has given oral consent
- Diagnosis of Mild Cognitive Disorder made by a neurologist at the Centre MÃ©moire Ressources et Recherche (CMRR) of the University Hospital of Dijon, following the recommendations of the National Institute for Aging and Alzheimer's Association (Albert et al., 2011) This diagnosis is based on psychometric tests, brain imaging and the evolution of cognitive disorders, including an MMSE test.
- Right-handed person
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neurological or psychiatric history with the exception of the TCL group.
- Follow-up of drug treatment in the last three months that may affect cognitive and/or motor skills.
- Received a shoulder prosthesis on the dominant side.
- Received a hip and/or knee replacement less than a year ago.
- Disabling joint disease of the hip or knee shoulder
- Protected adults (curatorship, guardianship)
- Person deprived of their liberty b judicial or administrative decision
- Pregnant, parturient or breastfeeding woman
- Major unable to consent
